byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan; Joseph Goldstein from New York; and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: Defense Dept releases its first extensive account of its 2015 airstrike on hospital run by Doctors Without Borders in Kunduz, Afghanistan, taking responsibility for mission that left 42 people dead; 16 American military personnel have been punished for their roles in strike, but none will face criminal charges because attack was unintentional.
lead_paragraph: A report more than 3,000 pages long describes the errors that led to the 2015 strike in Kunduz that killed 42 people. Sixteen American officers have been punished.

headline.main: Pentagon Details Chain of Errors in Strike on Afghan Hospital
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Details Chain of Errors in Afghan Strike

snippet: A report more than 3,000 pages long describes the errors that led to the 2015 strike in Kunduz that killed 42 people. Sixteen American officers have been punished.
